meanings.definition: In a manner that shows a lack of interest or concern
meanings.sent1: She waved dismissively at the idea of going to the party.
meanings.sent2: He answered dismissively, not bothering to look up from his book.
meanings.sent3: The cat yawned dismissively at the sight of the new toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old man shook his head dismissively, as if brushing off the memories.
meanings.sent5: The teacher sighed dismissively, clearly unimpressed by the excuse.

meanings.definition: In a way that indicates a lack of respect or approval
meanings.sent1: She spoke dismissively of the new policy changes at work.
meanings.sent2: The critic reviewed the movie dismissively, pointing out its flaws.
meanings.sent3: The child rolled his eyes dismissively at the suggestion of eating vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was met with dismissively raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The customer left the store dismissively, unhappy with the service received.
